quote.quotepara: here here here here here! I have been somewhat puzzled by how netbeans offer a large API for the winsys through the XML but not programmatically. Although I've managed around most of them, some are still annoying, and becoming more obvious with the merge to nb3.4 Surely what can be done and is supported via the XML should also be available and support (in openide) through the code!? Another example of where the XML just doesn't live up is where a platform application has hundreds of windows. Should i write a couple hundred XML entries!? I can solve it much better programmatically, but have had to delve into org.netbeans.core.windows to do so... :(
I do believe that these issues are already on the way to be solved and the winsys guys are doing a great job. Two examples: http://www.netbeans.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=21849

body.para: Please add your votes, comments to issue #21849.

quote.quotepara: Nonetheless Tim has a good point, why so much flexibility in the XML but not programmtically?
